question: Tamil Nadu government launched Amma Free Wi-Fi zones for how many cities?
explanation:
The Tamil Nadu government launched Amma Free Wi-Fi zones in 5 cities of Tamil Nadu. This scheme was announced by former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister J Jayalalithaa in September 2016. It was said that Wi-Fi zones will be set up in 50 spots, mainly in larger bus terminals, parks and commercial complexes. Amma Free Wi-Fi zones have been introduced at the following five locations:

Labour Statue, Marina, Chennai; Central bus stands, Salem and Tiruchirappalli; Gandhipuram bus stand in Coimbatore and Mattuthavani bus stand, Madurai.
